Message.Title: Paul Ryan Caves on Gays !
Message.Msg: You can't find a straight Republican any more ! Rep. Paul Ryan (R-Wis.) said Monday during a town hall event in Janesville, Wis., that he has changed his position on gay couples adopting children, WKOW reports. An audience member at the event asked Ryan why he doesn't support same-sex marriage. Ryan said that while he continues to believe marriage should only be between a man and a woman, he now regrets voting in 1999 to ban same-sex couples in the District of Columbia from adopting children. Heck, their last Prez nominee had gay prancing horses. You can't get any gayer than Mittens !!!!!

Topic.Title: Paul Ryan Caves on Gays !

Message.Msg: OK. Lets start talking about "caving on Gays". Anyone who set the caving record? Look no further than... Barack. He was for gay marriage before he was against it and than yet for it again. Those Republicans are falling far behind in changing hearts on the issue. After all, this is going to be the most important issue after this country falls into financial black hole.

Topic.Title: President Pantywaist Considering Sanctions Against Syria

Message.Msg: What good would sanctions do? They build they own ammunition, they build their own small arms, they even build a number of more complex systems under license from Russia. What exactly are we going to sanction that won't hit the civilians the worst?? This is the same sort of trap GW Bush allowed himself to get pinned in. As long as he kept sanctions on Iraq Saddam wasn't going to be a major regional threat, but he's going to have to use what hard currency he has to appease those who keep him in power rather than using it to buy goods like medicines, so as a result of those easy implemented "sanctions" the only people suffering weren't who we intended. On top of this we ALSO knew that if we DID life sanctions the ink wouldn't be dry before Saddam was using the income to rearm. That's one reason the WMD threat was peddled so heavy. Most brainless civilians can see an imminent threat even if there isn't one, but very few can see an obscure future threat, much less know what to do about it.
